transportAdvice: Istanbul has an extensive public transit network including metro, tram, bus, and ferry lines that connect most major tourist areas on both the European and Asian sides; the historic peninsula is walkable but hilly, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and frequently rainy with occasional snow, making it the least comfortable month for sightseeing.
Still cold and wet with a chance of snow, though days can occasionally brighten between rain spells.
Early spring brings mild but unpredictable weather with a mix of sunny days and showers.
Pleasant spring conditions with blooming tulips and comfortable temperatures for exploring on foot.
Warm and largely sunny, one of the best months to visit before summer crowds and heat arrive.
Warm and mostly dry with long daylight hours, ideal for outdoor sightseeing and Bosphorus cruises.
Hot and sunny with very little rain, peak tourist season with busy attractions and lively nightlife.
Similar to July, hot and dry with high visitor numbers; early mornings are best for outdoor exploration.
Warm and pleasant with thinning crowds, making it an excellent time to visit major sites comfortably.
Mild autumn weather with increasing rainfall, but still enjoyable for sightseeing with fewer tourists.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn deepens, with grey skies becoming more frequent.
Cold and rainy with a festive atmosphere in the city, though outdoor sightseeing can be uncomfortable.
